questions.question: Fill in with conjunction: 'She is rich _____ she is unhappy.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'Work hard _____ you will succeed.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'Hurry up _____ you will be late.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He is poor _____ honest.'
questions.explanation: 'But' shows contrast between poverty and honesty.

questions.question: Fill in with conjunction: 'I _____ my brother went to school.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'Is it a boy _____ a girl?'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He tried hard _____ he failed.'
questions.explanation: 'But' shows contrast between effort and result.

questions.question: Fill in with conjunction: 'I waited _____ she came.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'She sings _____ she dances.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He came _____ I was sleeping.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'Study hard _____ you will fail.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He is intelligent _____ lazy.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'I know _____ he is honest.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He ran fast _____ he missed the bus.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He _____ his friend are coming.'
Join using conjunction: 'He is rich. He is not happy.'
questions.answer: He is rich but he is not happy.

questions.question: Join using conjunction: 'Work hard. You will pass.'
questions.answer: Work hard and you will pass.

questions.question: Join using conjunction: 'She is poor. She is honest.'
Join using conjunction: 'Run fast. You will miss the train.'
questions.answer: Run fast or you will miss the train.

questions.question: Join using conjunction: 'He is clever. He is hardworking.'
questions.answer: He is both clever and hardworking.

questions.question: Fill in: 'She is _____ intelligent _____ hardworking.'
Fill in: '_____ take it _____ leave it.'
Fill in: 'He is _____ rich _____ poor.'
Fill in: '_____ had I reached _____ it started raining.'
Fill in: 'He _____ _____ passed but also topped.'
Fill in: 'She was _____ tired _____ she fell asleep.'
Fill in: '_____ he is poor, _____ he is happy.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'I came _____ you called me.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'I will help you _____ you promise to work hard.'
Fill in with conjunction: 'He failed _____ he did not study.'
Join using correlative conjunction: 'She can sing. She can dance.'
questions.answer: She can both sing and dance.

questions.question: Join using correlative conjunction: 'He is not lazy. He is not careless.'
questions.answer: He is neither lazy nor careless.

questions.question: Join using correlative conjunction: 'Take the medicine. You will die.'
questions.answer: Either take the medicine or you will die.

questions.question: Join using correlative conjunction: 'The bell rang. The students left.'
questions.answer: No sooner did the bell ring than the students left.

questions.question: Join using correlative conjunction: 'He is intelligent. He is hardworking.'
questions.answer: He is not only intelligent but also hardworking.

questions.question: Fill in: 'I know _____ you are honest.'
Fill in: 'Tell me _____ you want.'
Fill in: 'I don't know _____ he lives.'
questions.explanation: 'Where' introduces a noun clause of place.

questions.question: Fill in: 'Do you know _____ he is coming?'
questions.explanation: 'When' introduces a noun clause of time.

questions.question: Fill in: 'The boy _____ is standing there is my brother.'
questions.explanation: 'Who' introduces an adjective clause for persons.

questions.question: Fill in: 'The book _____ you gave me is interesting.'
questions.explanation: 'Which' or 'that' introduces an adjective clause for things.

questions.question: Fill in: 'This is the place _____ the accident happened.'
questions.explanation: 'Where' introduces an adjective clause of place.

questions.question: Fill in: 'I remember the day _____ we first met.'
questions.explanation: 'When' introduces an adjective clause of time.

questions.question: Fill in: 'The man _____ car was stolen reported to the police.'
Fill in: 'I will go _____ you come with me.'
Fill in: 'You will fail _____ you work hard.'
Fill in: 'I will wait _____ you come.'
Fill in: 'He left _____ I came.'
Fill in: 'I came _____ he had left.'
Fill in: '_____ it was raining, we stayed at home.'
Combine using subordinating conjunction: 'He is poor. He is honest.'
questions.answer: Though he is poor, he is honest.

questions.question: Combine using subordinating conjunction: 'It was raining. We stayed at home.'
questions.answer: Since it was raining, we stayed at home.

questions.question: Combine using subordinating conjunction: 'He studies hard. He wants to pass.'
questions.answer: He studies hard because he wants to pass.

questions.question: Combine using subordinating conjunction: 'You will pass. You work hard.'
questions.answer: You will pass if you work hard.

questions.question: Combine using subordinating conjunction: 'I arrived. He had left.'
questions.answer: When I arrived, he had left.

questions.question: Fill in: 'He is taller _____ his brother.'
Fill in: 'He behaves _____ he were the boss.'
Fill in: 'He ran fast _____ he might catch the train.'
Fill in: 'Walk carefully _____ you should fall.'
Fill in: 'He is _____ tall _____ his father.'
Fill in: 'She works _____ she is paid.'
Fill in: 'Stay here _____ I return.'
Fill in: 'He speaks _____ he knew everything.'
Fill in: 'I will come _____ I finish my work.'
Fill in: 'He left _____ saying goodbye.'
Join: 'The sun rose. The fog disappeared.'
questions.answer: When the sun rose, the fog disappeared.

questions.question: Join: 'He is intelligent. He is lazy.'
Join: 'She sings well. She dances well.'
questions.answer: She sings as well as dances well.

questions.question: Join: 'He is old. He is active.'
questions.answer: Though he is old, he is active.

questions.question: Join: 'She was ill. She came to school.'
questions.answer: Although she was ill, she came to school.

questions.question: Identify the type of conjunction: 'and'
Identify the type of conjunction: 'either...or'
Identify the type of conjunction: 'because'
questions.explanation: 'Because' joins a dependent clause to main clause.

questions.question: Identify the type of conjunction: 'but'
Identify the type of conjunction: 'not only...but also'
questions.explanation: 'Not only...but also' is used in pairs.

questions.question: Fill in: 'He can _____ read _____ write.'
Fill in: 'She is _____ beautiful _____ she is kind.'
Fill in: '_____ had he entered _____ the phone rang.'
Fill in: 'He was _____ weak _____ he could not walk.'
Fill in: 'It was _____ a hot day _____ we stayed indoors.'
Join: 'He is rich. He is unhappy.'
questions.answer: Though he is rich, yet he is unhappy.

questions.question: Join: 'The teacher entered. The students stood up.'
questions.answer: As soon as the teacher entered, the students stood up.
key_points: Use 'as soon as' for immediate action

questions.question: Join: 'He worked hard. He succeeded.'
questions.answer: He worked hard so he succeeded.

questions.question: Join: 'She is beautiful. She is intelligent.'
questions.answer: She is both beautiful and intelligent.

questions.question: Join: 'You can have tea. You can have coffee.'
questions.answer: You can have either tea or coffee.

questions.question: Fill in: 'I will not go _____ you come with me.'
Fill in: 'He acted _____ nothing had happened.'
questions.explanation: 'As if' shows manner contrary to reality.

questions.question: Fill in: 'Finish your work _____ you go out.'
Fill in: 'I have been waiting _____ morning.'
Fill in: 'He is richer _____ I thought.'
Fill in: 'I don't know _____ he will come.'
Fill in: 'He asked _____ I was ready.'
Fill in: 'Tell me _____ he said.'
Fill in: 'I wonder _____ he is.'
Fill in: 'She asked _____ I was going.'
Join: 'He fell ill. He ate too much.'
questions.answer: He fell ill because he ate too much.

questions.question: Join: 'I will help you. You must promise to work hard.'
questions.answer: I will help you provided you promise to work hard.

questions.question: Join: 'He ran fast. He might catch the train.'
questions.answer: He ran fast so that he might catch the train.

questions.question: Join: 'Walk carefully. You might fall.'
questions.answer: Walk carefully lest you should fall.

questions.question: Join: 'She is honest. Everyone trusts her.'
questions.answer: She is honest, therefore everyone trusts her.

questions.question: Fill in: 'You may go _____ you have finished.'
Fill in: 'I shall wait _____ you return.'
Fill in: 'He speaks _____ he were a king.'
Fill in: '_____ you apologize, I won't forgive you.'
Fill in: 'The child cried _____ his mother left.'
